title: Tortellini Bake

ingredients.cheese: shredded + cream cheese blend, to taste

instructions: Melt butter in a pan over medium heat. Whisk in flour slowly to form a roux. Gradually add milk, whisking constantly, then add shredded cheese and cream cheese until a smooth sauce forms with your desired consistency. Season with red pepper flakes, Italian seasoning, herb and garlic, onion and garlic, chili powder, mustard, Cajun seasoning, paprika, and seasoned salt to taste. Toss cooked tortellini in the sauce and bake if desired until heated through.

title: Corn Salsa Chicken
instructions: Season cubed chicken with salt, pepper, garlic powder, chili powder, paprika, cumin, and olive oil. Marinate briefly, then cook in a skillet sprayed with avocado oil until chicken is cooked through. In a separate bowl, make the street corn salsa by combining corn, light mayonnaise, cotija cheese, lime juice and zest, jalapeno, cilantro, avocado, and Tajin (if using). Serve the chicken over rice and top with the street corn salsa.

title: Watermelon Sandwiches
instructions: Slice watermelon into sandwich-sized pieces. Layer with sliced pickles, cheese, and fresh mint. Drizzle with balsamic glaze and serve chilled.

title: Roasted Butternut Pasta

ingredients.butternut_squash: cubed, amount to fill baking sheet
ingredients.chicken_broth: enough to thin sauce, approx 1–2 cups
ingredients.cheese: jalapeno havarti or cheese of choice, for topping

instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F. Toss cubed butternut squash with oil, salt, and pepper, then roast for about 20 minutes. Turn on broil and broil until well roasted. Blend the roasted squash with chicken broth, Italian herbs, garlic, sweet onion, turmeric, balsamic vinegar, Montreal steak spice, celery salt, and salt to taste to form a sauce. Cook rigatoni according to package directions, then combine pasta and sauce in a baking dish. Top with cheese and bake at 350°F for about 10 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly.

title: Greek Gnocchi
instructions: Cut zucchini into half moons and cook in a pan with olive oil until golden brown. Cook gnocchi according to package directions. Toss cooked gnocchi and zucchini with lemon juice and zest, dill, basil, red wine vinegar, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper to taste.

title: Baked Brie with Cherry Tomatoes
instructions: Preheat oven to 350–375°F. Cook cherry tomatoes in a skillet until soft and fragrant. Bake Brie in the oven until melted and gooey. Top the warm Brie with cooked cherry tomatoes and drizzle with balsamic glaze. Garnish with parsley and serve with garlic bread for scooping.

title: Quick Yeast Rolls
instructions: Mix shortening, sugar, and hot water. Allow to cool to lukewarm. Stir in dry yeast and let sit briefly. Stir in beaten egg, salt, and flour to form a dough. Let rise until doubled. Divide into 8 portions and place in greased muffin cups. Allow to rise again until doubled. Bake at 425°F for about 10 minutes or until golden.

title: Pumpkin Muffins
instructions: Beat eggs and sugar until well combined. Add pumpkin and oil and mix. In a separate bowl combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt. Stir the dry ingredients into the wet mixture until just combined. Fold in chocolate chips if using. Portion into muffin tins and bake at 350°F until a toothpick comes out clean.

title: Raspberry Breakfast Loaf
instructions: Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a bowl. Cut in cold butter until crumbly. Whisk egg, milk, and vanilla and stir into the flour mixture until moistened. Spread into a buttered loaf pan. For the filling, mix sugar, cornstarch, and water in a saucepan until smooth, then add raspberries and lemon juice. Cook until thickened. Pour over batter in loaf pan and swirl into batter. Make the topping by mixing flour, sugar, and butter until crumbly and sprinkle over top. Bake at 350°F until a toothpick in the loaf (not the filling) comes out clean.

title: Apple Sauce Crumble Muffins
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F. In a bowl, mix flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, 2 tsp cinnamon, and nutmeg. In a separate bowl whisk oil, eggs, 1 tsp cinnamon, and brown sugar. Add wet mixture to dry mixture and fold just until moistened. For the topping, combine melted butter, brown sugar, and cinnamon until wet and crumbly. Fill muffin cups about 3/4 full and top with crumble. Bake at 425°F for 5 minutes, then reduce oven to 350°F and bake for about 10 more minutes or until done.

title: Chicken Tetrazzini
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Cook linguine or spaghetti according to package directions. In a bowl, mix melted butter, cream of chicken soup, sour cream, chicken broth, salt, pepper, and garlic to taste. Place cooked pasta and diced chicken in a 9x13 casserole dish and pour sauce over. Stir to combine. Top with mozzarella and bake at 350°F for 40 minutes until bubbly and hot.

title: Roasted Veggie Bowl with Maple Chickpeas

ingredients.spice_blend: 1 tbsp (1 tsp oregano, 1 tsp ground sumac, 1 tsp coriander)

instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F and line a baking sheet with foil. Cut bell pepper into 1-inch strips (if using). Place peppers, broccoli, mushrooms, and sweet potatoes on the baking sheet. Toss with olive oil, salt, pepper, onion powder, garlic powder, herbs, and half of the garlic. Bake for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, mince jalapeno and drain and dry chickpeas. In a bowl mix parsley, cilantro, jalapeno (to taste), red wine vinegar, 1/4 cup olive oil, remaining garlic, salt, and pepper to create an herb dressing. In a hot skillet, cook chickpeas for 4–5 minutes until golden. Add spice blend, remaining garlic and jalapeno (to taste), 2 tbsp herb dressing, maple syrup, salt, and pepper. Toss to coat and cook briefly. After 15 minutes, flip roasted veggies, increase oven to 450°F and cook another 5–8 minutes until golden. Serve bowls with roasted veggies topped with maple chickpeas and crumbled feta, drizzled with remaining herb dressing as desired.

title: Greek Chicken Bowl

ingredients.spice_blend: 2 tsp (1/2 tsp dried dill, 1/2 tsp dried basil, 1/2 tsp ground sumac, 1/4 tsp onion powder, 1/4 tsp roasted garlic powder)

instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F with a rack 6 inches from the top. Toss diced potatoes with spice blend, oil, salt, and pepper. Spread on half of a baking sheet and roast for 12 minutes. Meanwhile, dice cucumber and tomatoes, and cut lemon in half. Place spinach in a bowl and toss with olive oil and salt. Add cucumber, tomato, onion, olives, dill, feta, and red wine vinegar to taste; toss to make the salad. Season chicken pieces with salt, pepper, herbs, and garlic. Toss chicken with oregano, half the lemon juice, and half the garlic. After potatoes have roasted 12 minutes, add chicken to the other half of the baking sheet and bake 5–7 minutes more. Turn on the broiler to 500°F and broil 2–3 minutes until potatoes are crispy and chicken is cooked through. Mix hummus with remaining garlic, lemon juice, salt, pepper, and a bit of water to thin to desired consistency. Assemble bowls with spinach salad, roasted potatoes, and chicken, drizzled with hummus sauce.

title: Loaded Breakfast Burrito Bowl

ingredients.spice_blend: 4 1/2 tsp (1 tsp chili powder, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp roasted garlic powder, 1 tsp onion powder, 1/2 tsp paprika)
ingredients.lime_salt: 1 tsp (1/4 tsp lime powder, 1/4 tsp sea salt, 1/4 tsp garlic powder, 1/4 tsp black pepper)

instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F. Boil eggs in salted water for 6 minutes, then cool and peel. Cut tortillas into 1/4-inch strips. Dice potatoes and sweet potatoes and toss with 2 tbsp olive oil, spice blend, salt, and pepper. Spread on half a baking sheet. Place tortilla strips on the other half and season with lime salt. Bake for 12 minutes, then remove tortilla strips and continue baking potatoes for another 7–8 minutes until golden. Dice tomato and combine with half the cilantro, onion, lime juice, salt, and pepper to make a fresh salsa. In a bowl, toss spinach, roasted potatoes, tortilla strips, chopped boiled eggs, avocado, salsa, remaining cilantro, and salsa aioli. Adjust seasoning to taste.

title: Alabama Style Chicken Sandwich

ingredients.mayo_mustard_blend: 1/3 cup (1/3 cup mayo, 1 tbsp yellow mustard)
ingredients.flour_blend: 3 tbsp (1 tbsp flour, 1 tsp smoked paprika, 1 tsp chili powder, 1 tsp onion powder, 1 tsp granulated garlic, 1 tsp dried basil, 1/2 tsp celery seed, 1/2 tsp annatto powder)

instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F with a rack 6 inches from the top. Toss diced potatoes with olive oil, salt, pepper, herbs and garlic, and smokey bacon spice if using. Roast for 15 minutes, flip, then roast another 5–7 minutes until crispy. Slice tomatoes into 1/4-inch rounds. In a bowl, mix mayo-mustard blend, minced onion, horseradish, apple cider vinegar, buffalo sauce, salt, and pepper to taste to make the Alabama-style sauce. Toss chicken strips in flour blend to coat and season well with salt. Pan-fry chicken in a hot skillet with oil for 4–6 minutes until cooked through. Toast brioche buns if desired. Assemble sandwiches with sauce, chicken, tomatoes, and spring mix. Serve with roasted potatoes.

title: Turkey Avocado Burgers

ingredients.spice_blend: 2 tsp (1/2 tsp chili powder, 1/2 tsp cumin, 1/2 tsp smoked paprika, 1/2 tsp granulated garlic)
ingredients.olive_oil: 2 tbsp for patties + more for corn

instructions: Cook corn in salted boiling water for 6–8 minutes and set aside. In a bowl, mix ground turkey, spice blend, Worcestershire sauce, breadcrumbs, 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper. Form into 1/2-inch patties. Combine mayonnaise and chipotle in adobo (or use chipotle mayo) to make chipotle mayo. Cook patties in a skillet or on a grill 10–12 minutes, flipping halfway, until cooked through. Assemble burgers on brioche buns with chipotle mayo, avocado, arugula, feta, onion, and grainy mustard. Serve with corn on the cob.

title: Lemon Greek Baked Orzo Skillet

ingredients.oregano: 5 g or 1–2 tsp (plus extra for topping)
ingredients.spice_blend: 3 1/2 tsp (1 tsp oregano, 1 tsp dried basil, 1 tsp dried parsley, 1/4 tsp cinnamon, 1/4 tsp ground allspice)

instructions: Turn on the broiler to 500°F with a rack 6 inches from the top. Cut zucchini into 1/4-inch half moons. Heat olive oil in an ovenproof skillet and cook ground beef with diced onion and spice blend until browned. Stir in tomato paste and garlic and cook 1–2 minutes until fragrant. Add diced tomatoes, 1 1/2 cups water, orzo, sugar, zucchini, and crumbled stock cube. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium and cook 12–14 minutes, stirring occasionally, until sauce thickens and orzo is al dente. Zest the lemon and mix feta, oregano, lemon zest, honey (to taste), and breadcrumbs in a bowl. Stir butter into the orzo mixture and season with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes. Stir in spinach until wilted. Sprinkle feta mixture over the top and broil 2 minutes until golden. Squeeze lemon juice over and garnish with dill.

title: Hazelnut and Sage Farfalle Alfredo

ingredients.spice_blend: 1 1/4 tsp (1/2 tsp garlic powder, 1/2 tsp onion powder, 1/4 tsp nutmeg)

instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Toss chickpeas, butternut squash, and cauliflower with 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper on a baking sheet. Roast 22–24 minutes until tender and golden. Cook farfalle for 11–13 minutes until al dente, reserving 2 cups pasta water. Roughly chop hazelnuts. In a large ovenproof skillet, melt 2 tbsp butter over medium-high heat. Add sage, onion, and garlic and cook 1 minute until fragrant. Stir in flour and cook 30–60 seconds until lightly browned. Add white cooking wine and cook until mostly evaporated. Reduce heat to medium and whisk in cream, crumbled stock cube, spice blend, 1 cup pasta water, and half the parmesan. Bring to a low boil and cook 3–4 minutes, stirring to thicken. Add more pasta water as needed for desired consistency. Season with salt and pepper. Add roasted cauliflower, butternut squash, chickpeas, and cooked farfalle; toss to coat. Top with hazelnuts and remaining parmesan. Turn on broiler to 450°F and broil 2–3 minutes until nuts are toasted and cheese is melted. Garnish with parsley.

title: Cheesy Spinach Stuffed Chicken
instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F. Combine cream cheese, parmesan cheese, and chopped spinach to make stuffing. Rinse basmati rice and cook in 1 1/4 cups salted water for 12–15 minutes until tender. Flatten chicken breasts to about 1/4 inch thick. Spread cream cheese mixture over each breast and fold in half. Season generously with Montreal chicken spice and herbs and garlic. Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet and sear stuffed chicken 2 minutes per side. Transfer to a baking sheet and bake 7–10 minutes until chicken reaches 165°F internally. While chicken finishes, heat 1 tbsp butter in the same skillet over medium heat. Whisk in flour until smooth, then whisk in white wine, whipping cream, dijon mustard, lemon juice, and 3 tbsp water. Cook 1–2 minutes until thickened. Serve stuffed chicken over rice topped with sauce and garnish with almonds and parsley.

title: Burrata Margherita Pizza
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Cut tomatoes in half. Mix romesco pizza sauce with chipotle in adobo to taste and season with salt and pepper. Break apart burrata and mix until smooth. Lightly oil and flour a baking sheet. Dust countertop with remaining flour and roll pizza dough to about 1/4 inch thick. Transfer to baking sheet and poke holes with a fork. Bake 3–4 minutes until dough starts to bubble, flip, and bake another 2–3 minutes. Remove from oven, spread pizza sauce evenly, and top with tomatoes and mozzarella. Return to oven for 6–9 minutes until cheese is golden. Remove, spoon burrata over the top, add fresh basil and spinach if desired, garnish with arugula, drizzle olive oil and balsamic reduction, then slice and serve.

title: Pulled Pork (Slow Cooker)

ingredients.brown_sugar: to coat top of pork, about 1/2–1 cup

instructions: Rub pork shoulder all over with herbs and garlic spice, onion powder, garlic powder, fresh garlic, and au jus spices. Sprinkle brown sugar over the top. Place in a slow cooker and cover with a mix of maple and honey garlic BBQ sauces. Add crumbled chicken stock cubes. Cook on LOW for 8–10 hours until pork is very tender and shreds easily. Shred and mix with cooking juices before serving.

title: One Pan Cheesy Chicken

ingredients.cheese: 1 cup shredded (plus extra for topping, optional)

instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F. Season flattened and cut-up chicken with garlic and herbs. In a buttered pan sauté chicken with chopped onion, celery, and chicken bouillon until mostly cooked. Stir in cream of broccoli and cream of chicken soups plus a dash of milk if desired. Add steamed broccoli, cooked rice, and cheese; mix well. Transfer to a baking dish, top with additional cheese if desired, sprinkle with paprika, cover, and bake 30 minutes. Uncover and bake 5–10 minutes more until bubbly.

title: Muffin Mix Pancakes
instructions: Whisk muffin mix, egg, and milk until just combined. For pancakes, cook spoonfuls of batter on a greased hot griddle until bubbles form and edges are set, then flip. For waffles, add a little oil to the batter, pour into a preheated waffle iron, and cook until golden.

title: Chicken Bacon Ranch Pasta
instructions: Cook noodles according to package directions. Cut bacon into small pieces and cook until crisp; remove and reserve bacon, keeping some bacon grease in the pan. Season cubed chicken with ranch seasoning, garlic powder, and onion powder, then sauté in the bacon grease until cooked through. Stir in alfredo sauce, second ranch packet, and shredded cheese until melted and combined. Add cooked noodles, bacon, parsley, and broccoli if using; toss and serve.

title: Strawberry Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine sliced strawberries and mini marshmallows. Fold in Cool Whip until everything is coated. Sprinkle dry Jell-O mix over the top and gently fold again until evenly colored. Chill before serving.

title: Noodle Salad

ingredients.dressing: to taste (likely mayo-based, from Grandma; e.g. mayonnaise, salt, pepper)

instructions: Cook noodles, drain, and cool. Cook bacon and chop into small bits. Dice peppers and cucumbers. Toss noodles, bacon, peppers, and cucumbers together in a large bowl. Add enough mayonnaise-based dressing to coat, season to taste, and chill before serving.

title: No Chip Left Behind Nachos
instructions: Preheat oven to 375–400°F. In a bowl, mix salsa chicken, some cheese, diced bell peppers, onions, and chopped bacon. Arrange scoop-style chips on a baking sheet. Fill each chip cup with nacho mixture and top with extra cheese. Bake until cheese is melted and bubbly.

title: Salsa Chicken

ingredients.salsa: 1–2 jars or enough to cover chicken

instructions: Add chicken, salsa, and corn to a slow cooker. Cook on LOW for 4–6 hours until chicken is tender. Shred chicken in the sauce. Serve over rice or in tortillas as wraps.

title: Loaded Fries

ingredients.fries: frozen or homemade, enough for 2–4 servings

instructions: Cook fries until crispy according to package or preferred method. Cook bacon and eggs to desired doneness. Layer fries on a plate, top with bacon, onions, and eggs. Drizzle with ketchup and aioli and serve immediately.

title: Hawaiian Haystacks
instructions: Reheat leftover chicken in gravy until hot. Serve over cooked rice and set out toppings: pineapple, Chinese noodles, coconut, tomatoes, and cucumbers. Let everyone build their own haystacks with desired toppings.

title: Veggie Pasta Primavera

ingredients.cream_sauce_spice_blend: 1 tbsp (20 g flour, 3 g garlic salt, 2 g onion powder)

instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F and bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Cook rigatoni 10–12 minutes and reserve 1 cup pasta water. Toss broccoli, peppers, and tomatoes with oil, salt, and pepper on a baking sheet and roast 15–20 minutes until tender. In a pot, sauté shallots and garlic in oil until softened. Add cream sauce spice blend and Italian herbs, then slowly whisk in reserved pasta water and vegetable stock reduction. Simmer, then whisk in cream cheese and most of the parmesan until smooth. Add cooked pasta, roasted veggies, and optional cooked chicken; toss to coat and adjust seasoning. Top with remaining parmesan.

title: Roasted Broccoli Pasta

ingredients.seasoning_for_chicken: to taste (e.g. Italian or herb blend)

instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Season broccoli with salt and pepper and roast 8 minutes. Pound chicken to 1/4 inch thick, season, and cook in a pan until done; cut into pieces. Cook spaghetti in salted boiling water. In the chicken pan, add garlic, a splash of white wine, and butter to deglaze. Stir in cream and cream cheese until melted and smooth, then add mozzarella and stir until combined. Toss in cooked noodles, chicken, and roasted broccoli. Serve immediately.

title: Chicken Stir Fry with Noodles

ingredients.soy_sauce: 10 tbsp total (8 tbsp for marinade, 2 tbsp to finish)
ingredients.water: a few tbsp, to soften noodles

instructions: Slice chicken and season with salt, pepper, chili flakes, honey, 8 tbsp soy sauce, and sesame seeds. Let sit briefly. Chop vegetables. Brown chicken in a large pan or wok, then add peppers and onion and cook until veggies are crisp-tender. Add stir fry noodles and a few tablespoons of water to help soften, tossing until heated through. Stir in extra honey and 2 tbsp soy sauce. Top with more sesame seeds before serving.

title: Loaded Baked Potato Soup
instructions: Bake potatoes until tender, then scoop out insides and roughly mash. Cook bacon until crisp, chop, and reserve 1 tbsp bacon grease. In a pot, heat bacon grease and 1 tbsp butter; sauté onion and garlic until soft. Stir in flour to make a roux, then slowly whisk in milk, half and half, sour cream, and chicken broth. Season with salt, pepper, and garlic salt and simmer 5–7 minutes until slightly thickened. Add cheese and bacon, stirring until melted, then stir in potatoes. Adjust seasoning and serve with extra cheese and bacon if desired.

title: Turmeric Chicken and Rice

ingredients.broth: enough to cover rice and chicken (about 2–2 1/2 cups)

instructions: Pound chicken breasts thin and coat with paprika, garlic, salt, and turmeric. Heat oil in a pan and sear chicken until crusted on both sides. Add peas and carrots to the pan, then stir in rice. Pour in enough broth to cover the rice and chicken. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium, cover, and cook until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed. Adjust seasoning and serve.

title: Garbage Bread
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F. Brown ground beef with onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Stir in ketchup, mustard, diced onions, chopped pickles, bacon, and cheese until cheese melts. Spread pizza dough on a baking sheet and spoon meat mixture down the center. Cut 1-inch strips along both long sides of dough and braid over the filling. Brush top with melted butter and herbs and garlic seasoning. Bake 20–25 minutes until golden brown and cooked through.

title: Chicken Crust Pizza
instructions: Preheat oven to about 400°F. Mix drained canned chicken, egg, parmesan, basil, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Spread mixture on a lined baking sheet into a thin crust. Bake until firm and lightly browned. Add pizza sauce, cheese, and desired toppings. Return to oven until cheese is melted and bubbly.

title: Mozzarella Chicken in Tomato Cream Sauce
instructions: Season pounded chicken with garlic and herbs. Brown chicken in an oven-safe skillet and remove. In the same skillet, sauté minced garlic briefly, then add crushed and diced tomatoes and Italian seasoning. Simmer, then stir in heavy cream, parmesan, and basil. Return chicken breasts to the sauce and simmer about 5 minutes. Top each piece with fresh mozzarella and broil until cheese is melted and lightly browned. Serve over noodles with extra basil.

title: Stuffing Chicken Bake
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Flatten chicken breasts, season with garlic and herbs, and lay in a casserole dish. Mix cream of mushroom soup with milk and pour over chicken. Layer sliced cheese on chicken, then sprinkle dry stuffing mix evenly over the top. Pour melted butter over stuffing. Bake about 1 hour or until chicken is cooked through and stuffing is browned. Serve over rice.

title: Mexican Spaghetti (One-Pan Chicken and Rice)

ingredients.chicken_breasts: 1 lb, flattened and cut into 1-inch pieces
ingredients.rotel: 1 10-oz can diced tomatoes with green chilies

instructions: Season flattened chicken pieces with Montreal chicken spice, salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes. Heat olive oil in a large skillet and cook chicken until browned. Stir in uncooked rice, Rotel, tomato sauce, and water. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce heat. Cook 10 minutes, stir, then cover and cook another 10 minutes or until rice is tender. Top with shredded cheese, turn off heat, and let sit 5 minutes to melt. Serve with sour cream and chopped scallions.

title: Cold Cut Salad
instructions: Chop sweet bell peppers, tomatoes, pickles, lettuce, and roast beef or other lunch meat into bite sized pieces. Toss everything together in a large bowl. Add small pieces or dollops of herb and garlic cream cheese and gently mix to distribute. Serve chilled.

title: Beef Bolognese Bake
instructions: Boil linguine in salted water 10 to 12 minutes, reserving some pasta water. In a large skillet, cook onions and peppers in oil until soft. Add Italian herbs, chili flakes, salt, and pepper. Add ground beef and cook until no longer pink, seasoning with rosemary, onion powder, and garlic powder. Stir in marinara sauce, tomato paste, splash of balsamic, and basil. Simmer and thin with reserved pasta water if needed. Toss with linguine and serve with parmesan and basil. Optional: use penne, mix sauce and pasta with cheese in an oven dish and bake about 10 minutes at 350 degrees or in an air fryer until bubbly.

title: Cheddar Crusted Chicken with Sweet Potato Mash

ingredients.mayonnaise: for coating chicken, a few tbsp

instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Pound chicken to 1/4 inch thick and season with garlic herb spice, salt, and pepper. In a shallow bowl, mix panko, shredded cheese, garlic powder, and smoked paprika. Coat one side of each chicken breast with mayonnaise, then press the mayo side into the panko mixture. Place chicken panko side up on a baking sheet and bake 18 to 20 minutes or until cooked through. Meanwhile, boil sweet potatoes in salted water 10 to 12 minutes until tender. Drain and mash with sour cream, butter, chives, salt, and pepper to desired consistency. Serve chicken alongside sweet potato mash.

title: Cauliflower Mac and Cheese

ingredients.cream_sauce_spice_blend: 2 tbsp (20 g all purpose flour, 3 g garlic salt, 2 g onion powder)

instructions: Boil rigatoni in salted water until al dente, reserving some pasta water. In a pan, melt 1 tbsp butter and toast panko crumbs until golden. Transfer to a bowl and mix with half of the parmesan, salt, and pepper. Broil cauliflower florets 8 to 10 minutes until tender and slightly charred, seasoning with salt and pepper. Roughly chop spinach and dice onion. Heat 2 tbsp oil in a large saucepan and cook onion until soft. Add cream sauce spice blend and 1 tbsp butter, then slowly whisk in cream and 1 cup of reserved pasta water, whisking to avoid lumps. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer 2 to 3 minutes until thickened. Stir in dijon, cheddar, and remaining parmesan and cook until melted. Season with salt and pepper. Add noodles, spinach, and cauliflower to sauce and toss. Top with panko mixture and serve. Optionally broil briefly to crisp the topping.

title: Greek Salad
instructions: Dice cucumbers, tomatoes, and purple onion into a large bowl. Toss with red wine vinegar and Neapolitan herb balsamic vinegar to taste. Season with salt and pepper and serve chilled.

title: Cider Braised Chicken and Apples

ingredients.apple: 1 sweet variety, cored and cut into wedges

instructions: Pound chicken breasts to about 1/4 inch thick, pat dry, and season with garlic herb spice, salt, and pepper. Sear in a heated pan with oil for 1 to 2 minutes per side until partially cooked and crusted, then remove. In the same pan, melt butter over medium heat and add chopped shallot and apple wedges. Season with garlic herb spice and sauté 1 to 2 minutes until they begin to soften. Add apple juice and apple cider vinegar and cook 30 to 60 seconds, stirring. Add heavy cream, vegetable demi glace, and 1/2 cup water. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer and return chicken to the pan. Cook 6 to 8 minutes or until chicken is fully cooked and sauce has thickened.

title: Satay Ground Beef and Noodle Salad with Almond Butter Sauce

ingredients.indonesia_spice_blend: 13 g (sea salt, brown sugar, sesame, spices)
ingredients.water: for thinning sauce and cooking noodles

instructions: Boil a medium pot of salted water. Thinly slice scallions, separating white parts from green tops. Mix almond butter sauce in a bowl: ginger paste, almond butter, soy sauce, maple syrup, salt, pepper, and 2 tbsp water. Cook rice noodles 4 to 5 minutes, drain, rinse with cold water, and toss with a drizzle of oil to prevent sticking. Toss noodles with spiralized carrots, half the bok choy, half the almond butter sauce, a drizzle of oil, half the Indonesia spice blend, salt, and pepper. In a skillet, sauté garlic and scallion whites in oil for 30 to 60 seconds until fragrant. Add ground beef and season with remaining spice blend, salt, and pepper; cook until no longer pink. Add remaining bok choy and cook 1 to 2 minutes until wilted. Combine beef mixture with noodles and remaining almond butter sauce, toss, and garnish with scallion greens.

title: Turkey Shawarma Bowls

ingredients.couscous_water: 1 tbsp or more from cooking water

instructions: Cut tomatoes in half, slice cucumber, mince garlic, and grate carrots. Pat turkey dry and season generously with chicken shawarma spice blend. Cook couscous in boiling water until tender, about 6 to 8 minutes, then drain and return to the pot. Stir in broth concentrate, butter, salt, and pepper. In a skillet, heat oil and cook turkey strips 5 to 6 minutes, flipping occasionally, until browned and cooked through. In a bowl, mix mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, tahini, 1/2 tsp minced garlic, and about 1 tbsp couscous water to thin; season with pepper. Assemble bowls with couscous, turkey, tomatoes, carrots, and cucumber. Drizzle with tahini sauce.

title: GR Orange Julius
instructions: Combine milk, water, frozen orange juice concentrate, sugar, vanilla, and ice cubes in a blender. Blend until smooth and frothy. Serve immediately.

title: GR Rootbeer (Homemade Fermented)
instructions: Fill a clean jug with warm water. Stir in sugar and root beer extract until dissolved. Sprinkle yeast over the top and stir gently. Keep the jug warm for about 24 hours to ferment lightly. Chill before serving, watching pressure if stored in sealed containers.

title: GR WW Buns

ingredients.brown_flour: 4 cups initially, plus more as needed

instructions: Dissolve yeast in 2 cups warm water with a little sugar and let proof. Beat eggs with 1 cup sugar. In a large bowl, mix hot water, oil, and 4 cups brown flour. Add salt, egg mixture, and yeast mixture. Gradually add additional white and brown flour until a soft, elastic dough forms. Let rise until doubled, punch down once, shape into buns, and place on baking sheets. Let rise again, then bake at 375°F about 20 to 30 minutes until golden.

title: GR Biscuits
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F. Combine flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, and cream of tartar. Cut in cold butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir together beaten egg and milk, then add to dry ingredients and mix just until combined. Turn dough onto a floured surface, pat or roll to about 1 inch thick, and cut biscuits. Place on a baking sheet and bake 10 to 12 minutes until golden.

title: GR Peach Breakfast Casserole

ingredients.baked_croissants: enough to fill casserole, torn in pieces

instructions: Break baked croissants into bite sized pieces and place in a greased casserole dish. Whisk eggs, brown sugar, milk, nutmeg, cinnamon, and vanilla together and pour over the croissants. Layer well drained peach slices over the top. Cover with foil and refrigerate overnight. In the morning, bake at 350°F for 35 to 40 minutes, uncovering for the last 10 minutes to brown.

title: GR Alfredo Sauce
instructions: Cook butter, cream, and cream cheese over medium heat, whisking until melted and smooth. Mix minced garlic, garlic powder, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper together, then whisk into the cream mixture. Add parmesan and bring to a simmer, cooking 3 to 5 minutes until the sauce starts to thicken. Serve over pasta.

title: GR Chicken Salad and Rice Bake
instructions: In a large bowl, combine cooked chicken, celery, onions, cooked rice, cream of mushroom soup, and mayonnaise. Mix well and season with salt and pepper if desired. Spread into a greased casserole dish and bake at 350°F until heated through and slightly browned on top.

title: GR Crockpot Chicken and Stuffing

ingredients.water: enough to moisten stuffing (per box directions)

instructions: In a bowl, mix cream of chicken soup, sour cream, stuffing mix, water according to stuffing directions, and broccoli. Place chicken breasts in the bottom of a crockpot and pour stuffing mixture over the top. Cook on HIGH for about 4 hours or LOW for 6 to 7 hours until chicken is cooked and stuffing is tender.

title: GR Crockpot Baked Potato Soup
instructions: Add frozen hashbrowns, chicken stock, cream of chicken soup, cream cheese, dried onions, bacon bits, and corn to a crockpot. Stir to combine. Cook on HIGH for 4 to 5 hours, stirring occasionally to melt cream cheese. Stir in shredded cheese near the end and heat until melted. Serve hot.

title: GR Cloud Bread
instructions: Preheat oven to 300°F and line a baking sheet with parchment. Beat egg whites with cream of tartar until stiff peaks form. In another bowl, beat egg yolks, cream cheese, and sugar or honey until smooth. Gently fold yolk mixture into the whites until just combined. Spoon dollops onto prepared pan to form 6 to 8 rounds. Bake 25 to 30 minutes for 6 buns or 20 to 30 minutes for 8 smaller clouds, until golden and set.

title: Thanksgiving Turkey with Maple Bacon Butter Rub
instructions: The night before cooking, separate the turkey skin from the meat gently. Melt butter and mix with garlic herb spice, onion powder, garlic powder, rosemary, and salt. Wearing gloves if desired, rub this mixture generously under the skin all over the turkey. Tuck strips of thick cut bacon under the skin on top of the butter. On the outside, lather the turkey in maple syrup, starting on the bottom and then the top. Generously sprinkle each spice over the maple-coated skin. Place the seasoned turkey in an oven bag and refrigerate overnight. Cook the turkey the next day according to its weight and package instructions. Strain the cooking liquid before making gravy; the drippings make excellent gravy.

title: Holiday Biscuits
instructions: Same as GR Biscuits: combine dry ingredients, cut in butter, stir in beaten egg and milk mixture, roll to 1 inch thick, cut, and bake until golden. Perfect as a holiday side.

title: Holiday Mashed Potatoes
instructions: Boil potatoes in salted water until tender. Drain and mash with sour cream and butter to desired consistency. Generously season with minced garlic, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper. Top with cheese and chopped scallions if desired.

title: Broccoli Casserole with Stuffing Top

ingredients.frozen_broccoli: enough to cover 9x13 inch casserole dish

instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Spread frozen broccoli in a 9x13 inch pan and place in the oven to thaw and warm slightly. In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat and whisk in flour to make a roux. Mix in seasonings and slowly add milk or cream, whisking until smooth. Simmer until slightly thickened, then stir in cheese to desired flavor and thickness, thinning with more milk if needed. Pour sauce over warmed broccoli. Prepare stuffing mix using chicken broth instead of water. Spread cooked stuffing over sauced broccoli. Bake until broccoli is tender and stuffing is browned.

title: Grandma’s Chocolate Chip Cookie

ingredients.flour: 4 cups plus a bit extra as needed
ingredients.salt: 1 tsp (use grainy salt for best taste)
ingredients.milk: splash, to adjust texture if needed

instructions: Partially melt butter; reserve about 1 cup to add at the end if you want extra richness. Cream butter, brown sugar, and white sugar until smooth. Add vanilla and egg and beat until combined. In a separate bowl, mix flour, baking soda, and salt. Stir dry ingredients into wet until just blended; add a bit of extra flour if dough seems too soft. Fold in chocolate chips. If needed, add a splash of milk at the end to reach the desired texture. Scoop onto baking sheets and bake at 325°F for about 15 minutes or until just set.

title: Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies
instructions: Partially melt margarine or butter. Cream margarine, white sugar, and brown sugar until smooth. Add vanilla, eggs, salt, baking soda, and baking powder and beat until combined. Stir in flour and oats until a thick dough forms. Fold in chocolate chips. Scoop onto baking sheets and bake at 325°F until lightly golden around the edges.

title: Oatmeal Cookies with Coconut
instructions: Cream butter with white and brown sugar until light. Add beaten eggs and mix well. In a separate bowl, combine flour, salt, baking soda, and baking powder. Stir dry ingredients into the butter mixture. Fold in oats and coconut. Drop by spoonfuls onto baking sheets and bake at about 350°F until lightly golden.

title: Cinnamon Bun Filling
instructions: Combine brown sugar, cream, and corn syrup in a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave for about 3 minutes until hot and smooth, stirring as needed. Pour over unbaked buns in a pan and bake buns as usual.

title: Cream Cheese Sugar Cookies
instructions: Cream together sugar, butter, and cream cheese until fluffy. Add egg, vanilla, and nutmeg and mix well. Stir in flour and baking powder just until combined, being careful not to overmix. Chill dough for 2 hours. Roll out on a floured surface, cut into shapes, and bake at 375°F for 8 to 10 minutes. Cookies should remain light in color.

title: Chocolate Almond Cookies
instructions: Beat butter, white sugar, and brown sugar together until creamy. Add eggs and vanilla or almond extract and beat well. Stir in cocoa, baking soda, salt, and flour until a thick dough forms. Roll into small balls and place on baking sheets. Bake at about 350°F until just set.

title: Peanut Butter Cookies
instructions: Cream peanut butter, butter, white sugar, and brown sugar together until smooth. Add eggs and vanilla and beat well. In another bowl, combine flour, baking soda, and salt. Stir dry ingredients into the wet mixture until a dough forms. Roll into balls, flatten with a fork in a criss-cross pattern, and bake at about 350°F until lightly golden.

title: Rhubarb Cake (or Fruit Cake)

ingredients.rhubarb: 2 cups, chopped and dredged in 1 tsp flour (or other fruit)

instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Cut rhubarb into 1/2 inch pieces and dredge with 1 tsp flour. Cream butter and sugar together, then beat in egg and vanilla. Add flour, baking soda, and salt, alternating with buttermilk, and mix until smooth. Gently fold in rhubarb (or other fruit). Spread batter in a greased 9x13 pan. Mix topping ingredients (butter, brown sugar, cinnamon) until crumbly and sprinkle over the batter. Bake at 350°F for about 40 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean. Serve with cream or ice cream.

title: Blueberry Buckle
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Whisk together flour, sugar, and baking powder. In another bowl, mix egg, milk, softened butter, and lemon peel. Combine wet and dry ingredients and stir just until mixed. Fold in blueberries. Spread in a greased 8x8 pan. For topping, mix sugar, flour, and cinnamon, then cut in cold butter until crumbly. Sprinkle over batter. Bake until a toothpick comes out clean and top is golden.

title: Sex in a Pan
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix pecans (if using), flour, and melted butter. Press into a lightly greased 9x13 pan and bake about 25 minutes. Cool completely. Whip cream cheese, icing sugar, and 1 cup Cool Whip; spread over cooled crust and refrigerate. Beat cold milk with chocolate and vanilla instant puddings until thick and let set briefly. Spread pudding over cream cheese layer. Top with remaining Cool Whip and garnish with chocolate shavings. Chill 2 to 3 hours or freeze before serving.

title: Debbie’s Caramel Sauce
instructions: In a saucepan, combine corn syrup, brown sugar, butter, and salt. Boil until the mixture reaches a heavy syrup consistency, stirring frequently. Remove from heat and stir in heavy cream until smooth. Cool slightly before serving.

title: Puppy Chow Truffles

ingredients.chocolate_chips: 1 1/2 bags total (1 bag for mix, 1/2 bag for coating approx.)

instructions: Crush Chex Mix cereal into a bowl. Melt about 1 bag of chocolate chips with peanut butter until smooth. Mix the chocolate-peanut butter mixture with crushed cereal and roll into balls. Melt remaining chocolate chips and roll balls in melted chocolate, then dust or roll in powdered sugar. For regular puppy chow instead of truffles, don’t crush cereal and simply coat cereal with chocolate and peanut butter mixture, then toss in powdered sugar.

title: GR Fudge
instructions: Combine sugar, cocoa, syrup, and cream in a heavy saucepan. Cook, stirring, until mixture reaches 227°F on a candy thermometer (soft ball stage). Remove from heat and add butter and vanilla. Cool slightly, then beat until thick and creamy. Pour into a buttered pan and cool completely before cutting.

title: Easy Homemade Fudge
instructions: Line a baking sheet or pan with parchment. Melt chocolate chips over medium heat, stirring constantly. Add butter and mix until combined, then stir in sweetened condensed milk until smooth. Pour into prepared pan and spread evenly. Chill in the freezer until firm, then cut into squares.

title: GR Apple Crisp (Microwave)
instructions: In an 8 inch pan, mix diced apples with white sugar and cinnamon. In a separate bowl, combine brown sugar, oats, flour, salt, and melted butter until crumbly. Sprinkle over apples. Microwave on high for 8 to 10 minutes until apples are tender and topping is cooked.

title: Lemonade Cheesecake Pie
instructions: Combine evaporated milk and instant pudding mix and beat until thick. In another bowl, beat cream cheese until smooth, then add lemonade concentrate and mix well. Fold pudding mixture into cream cheese mixture until fully combined. Stir in lemon zest if using. Pour into prepared pie crust and chill until set.

title: Crazy Pie Crust
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and softened butter. Beat well until a thick batter forms. Pour into a well-greased 9 inch pie plate. Pour pie filling into the center of the batter, leaving about 1 inch around the edge. Sprinkle with additional sugar and spices if desired. Bake 35 to 40 minutes until crust is golden and filling is bubbly.

title: Cinnamon Bread
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease two loaf pans. Beat butter, sugar, eggs, and vanilla with an electric mixer until creamy. Add buttermilk, flour, and baking soda and mix with a spoon until combined. Mix topping sugar and cinnamon. Fill each loaf pan halfway with batter and sprinkle with about 3/4 of the cinnamon sugar mixture, swirling if desired. Add remaining batter and sprinkle with remaining topping. Bake at 350°F until a toothpick comes out clean (time will vary by pan size, usually 45–60 minutes).

title: Christmas Pudding (Suet Pudding)
instructions: Mix sugar, flour, bread crumbs, suet, carrots, apples, raisins, and nuts in a large bowl. Beat eggs and stir into the mixture until everything is well combined. Traditionally this is steamed or boiled as a pudding; cook according to your preferred Christmas pudding method until firm and cooked through. Serve with sauce or cream.

title: Peanut Brittle
instructions: Grease a 15x10 inch jelly roll pan. In a large heavy saucepan, combine sugar, corn syrup, water, butter, and salt. Cook over medium heat, stirring until sugar dissolves. Continue cooking, stirring occasionally, until syrup reaches 300°F (hard crack) on a candy thermometer. Stir in peanuts. Remove from heat, quickly stir in baking soda and vanilla (mixture will foam), and immediately pour into prepared pan, spreading quickly. Cool completely and break into pieces.

title: GR Apple Filling
instructions: Cook apples and water together in a saucepan until apples are tender. Add sugar, cinnamon, and tapioca and boil for a few more minutes until thickened. Cool thoroughly before using as pie or dessert filling.

title: GR Peach Cobbler
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Spray a 10x8 pan and place sliced fruit in the bottom. Cream butter with 3/4 cup sugar, then beat in a pinch of salt, flour, and milk to make a batter. Spread batter over fruit. In a bowl, mix 1/2 cup sugar, cornstarch, a pinch of salt, and optional cinnamon and nutmeg. Sprinkle evenly over batter. Pour 1 cup boiling water over the entire pan, making sure sugar dissolves. Bake at 350°F for about 45 minutes until golden and bubbling.

title: GR Homemade Cream Centre Chocolates
instructions: Combine sugar, heavy cream, and corn syrup in a large pot and cook until mixture boils. Continue boiling to the soft ball stage. Remove from heat and add butter. Pour onto a pan and let cool completely (outside in the snow is traditional). Beat and fold the mixture until it loses its shine and softens. Add vanilla and knead in. Roll into balls and coat in melted chocolate.

title: GR Christmas Tree Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F. Cream butter and sugar on high until fluffy. Add beaten egg and almond extract and mix until combined. Stir in flour and baking powder until a smooth dough forms. Roll out on a floured surface and cut into tree or other shapes. Bake at 375°F for about 10 minutes; if cookies turn brown, they are overcooked.

title: GR Christmas Cookie Icing
instructions: Beat golden Crisco, confectioners sugar, milk, and extract together in a large bowl until fluffy and well combined. Use to frost cooled cookies.

title: GR Molasses Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F. Cream butter and sugar until fluffy. Add molasses and mix thoroughly. Beat in eggs until smooth. In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves. Gradually add dry ingredients to wet mixture and mix until fully combined. Form dough into balls and roll in sugar. Place on baking sheets and bake at 325°F for about 10 minutes. Cookies will not spread much.

title: GR Ginger Cookies (Soft)
instructions: Cream butter and sugar, then add molasses and beat well. Add eggs and mix until smooth. In a separate bowl, combine flour, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and baking soda. Mix dry ingredients into wet until combined. Form balls, roll in sugar if desired, and bake at about 325–350°F until set but still soft.

title: GR Ginger Cookies
instructions: Cream margarine and sugar until fluffy. Add molasses and eggs and beat well. In another bowl mix flour, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and baking soda. Combine dry with wet ingredients and mix thoroughly. Shape into balls, roll in sugar if desired, and bake at about 325–350°F until done.

title: GR Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions: Beat margarine with white and brown sugar until fluffy. Mix in eggs, vanilla, salt, baking soda, and baking powder until combined. Stir in flour and chocolate chips. Drop onto baking sheets and bake at 350°F until lightly golden.

title: GR Sugar Cookies
instructions: Combine flour, baking powder, salt, and nutmeg. Cream shortening, vanilla, and sugar until creamy. Beat in eggs. Stir dry ingredients into the creamed mixture. Chill dough for at least 2 hours. Roll 1/8 inch thick, cut shapes, and bake at about 350°F until just lightly colored.

title: GR Eatmore Rolls
instructions: In a saucepan, simmer peanut butter, honey, and chocolate chips together over medium heat for 8–10 minutes, stirring until smooth. Remove from heat and mix in wheat germ, peanuts, and sunflower seeds. Roll mixture into logs on parchment paper and freeze. Slice into rounds to serve.

title: GR Turtle Squares
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix flour, 1 cup brown sugar, and 1/2 cup butter until crumbly. Press firmly into a 9x13 glass pan. Arrange pecans evenly over the crust. In a saucepan, heat 3/4 cup brown sugar and remaining butter (1 cup), stirring constantly until it boils. Boil just under 1 minute, then pour evenly over pecan-topped crust. Bake at 350°F for about 20 minutes. Remove from oven, sprinkle chocolate chips over hot surface, and let sit 2 minutes, swirling as they melt without fully spreading. Cool and cut into bars.

title: GR Chocolate Zucchini Bread
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease and flour a bundt pan. Whisk together flour, cream powder (if that’s powdered cream or use cream as ingredient?), baking powder, salt, and cinnamon. Cream butter and sugar, then beat in eggs and vanilla. Stir in shredded zucchini. Add dry ingredients alternately with milk until batter is smooth. Pour into prepared bundt pan and bake at 350°F for about 1 hour or until a toothpick comes out clean.

title: GR Banana Bread or Pumpkin Bread
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Beat eggs and sugar together until well mixed. Add oil and mashed bananas (or pumpkin) and beat again. In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt. Stir dry mixture into the wet ingredients and mix well. Pour into greased loaf pans or muffin tins. Bake loaves about 40 minutes (muffins about 20) or until the center springs back when lightly pressed. For fluffier, drier muffins, cut baking soda and powder in half.

title: GR Carrot Pineapple Bread
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease and flour loaf or cake tins. Beat sugar, oil, and eggs together until well combined. Mix in carrots, pineapple, walnuts, and vanilla. In another bowl, combine flour, salt, baking soda, and cinnamon. Stir into wet mixture until just combined. Pour into prepared tins and bake until a toothpick comes out clean (time depends on pan size, typically 40–60 minutes for loaves).

title: GR Carrot Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Beat eggs and brown sugar well. Add oil and grated carrots and mix. In a separate bowl, combine baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, salt, and flour. Mix dry ingredients into wet until smooth. Pour into greased baking pan and bake at 350°F for about 35 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Frost as desired.

title: GR Streamlined Puff Pastry Dough
instructions: Cut cold butter into flour until completely mixed but still with small bits. Stir in sour cream until thoroughly blended into a soft dough. Divide dough in half, wrap each piece, and chill for at least 8 hours. When ready to use, roll pastry on a well-floured cloth-covered board as desired. Chill scraps before re-rolling. Bake assembled pastries at 350°F until golden.

title: GR Bread Pudding
instructions: Preheat oven to 300°F. Place bread cubes in a 13x9 inch pan. In a bowl, beat eggs and sugar, then add cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and milk and beat until smooth. Pour mixture over bread, pressing down gently to soak. Bake at 300°F for 45 to 50 minutes until set and lightly browned.

title: GR Cream Pie Filling
instructions: Heat milk just until warm. In a bowl, mix flour, sugar, and cornstarch, then whisk into beaten eggs. Add this mixture to the warm milk and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in canned milk, salt, and vanilla. Cool completely. Divide between pie shells and add desired flavors or mix-ins such as bananas, coconut, or drained pineapple. Makes enough filling for about 3 pies.

title: GR Ice Cream Custard Base
instructions: Make as for GR Cream Pie but omit the flour and increase cornstarch to 1 cup. Do not add canned milk. Adjust sugar to taste for ice cream. Cook until thickened, then cool completely. Use as a custard base for homemade ice cream.

title: GR Caramel Popcorn
instructions: Cook sugar, honey, and 1 cup cream together for 5 minutes, stirring until sugar dissolves. Add remaining 1 cup cream and continue cooking until soft ball stage. Pour hot caramel over popped popcorn and toss to coat. Let cool slightly before eating.

title: GR Caramels
instructions: Cook sugar, honey, and 1 cup cream together for 5 minutes. Add heavy cream and continue to cook until mixture reaches soft ball stage. Pour into a greased pan and cool completely. Cut into pieces and wrap in waxed paper.

title: GR Caramel Sauce (Large Batch)
instructions: Combine sugar, brown sugar, corn syrup, evaporated milk, cream, and butter in a large pot. Cook over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until everything is melted and combined. Once the mixture begins to bubble, set a timer for 12 minutes and continue cooking and stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla. Cool slightly before serving or storing.

title: GR Cinnamon Spread
instructions: In a medium bowl, beat butter, honey, powdered sugar, and cinnamon until smooth. Add a pinch of salt and beat again, then taste and adjust honey, cinnamon, or salt to your preference. Serve on toast, pancakes, or bread.

title: Grandma Ripley’s Dole Whip
instructions: In a blender, combine pineapple chunks, Cool Whip, honey, and pineapple juice. Blend until smooth, adding ice to thicken and chill to a soft-serve consistency. Serve immediately.

title: GR Ice Cream for Freezer

ingredients.cream: to add next day, amount to desired richness

instructions: Warm milk in a large pot. Beat eggs with sugar and cornstarch until smooth. Slowly add egg mixture to warm milk, stirring constantly. Cook until it boils and thickens. Cool overnight in the fridge. The next day, add cream and fruit if desired, then freeze in an ice cream freezer according to manufacturer directions.

title: Snickers Bark

ingredients.chocolate: melted, enough to coat and drizzle

instructions: Flatten dates into bite-sized pieces and place on parchment. Top each with a bit of peanut butter and peanuts. Drizzle or coat with melted chocolate to form bark-like clusters. Chill until set, then break or cut into pieces.
